content: We will have a "social hour" at today's CTCFT! Post ideas for breakout rooms here! Don't use this topic for general chatter, though. (Blog post explaining this coming soon)
I wanna make a breakout room focused on writing mentor instructions for help-wanted issues and hanging out in general

Sean Chen (he/him) said:

A great icebreaker question I got asked in a group setting recently was "what's your favorite sensation?" That yielded a lot of really interesting and varied answers from people.
Easy icebreaker idea: "What are you doing with Rust" (too easy?)
One I've used specifically for Rust groups is "what's your favorite crate?"

Jane Lusby said:

I wanna make a breakout room focused on writing mentor instructions for help-wanted issues and hanging out in general

I've changed my mind and I think I might want to make my breakout room be for talking about the new error handling experiment crate I'm working on for the error handling project group: github.com/yaahc/trial-and-error/

nikomatsakis said:

"Favorite unstable feature and why"

Related: "what would it take to get that feature stabilized"
